information.title: Constitutional Provisions
information.description: Part XI of the Indian Constitution (Articles 245-263) deals with relations between the Union and the States, including provisions for inter-state relations.

information.title: Legislative Relations
information.description: The Seventh Schedule divides legislative powers between the Union and States through Union, State, and Concurrent Lists. In case of conflict, the Union law prevails in the Concurrent List.

information.title: Administrative Relations
information.description: The Constitution provides for cooperation between the Centre and States in administrative matters. The Union can give directions to the States on certain matters.

information.title: Inter-State Council
information.description: Article 263 provides for the establishment of an Inter-State Council to investigate and discuss subjects of common interest between the Union and States.

information.title: Zonal Councils
information.description: Five Zonal Councils (Northern, Central, Eastern, Western, and Southern) have been set up to foster cooperation among states in each zone.

information.title: Inter-State Water Disputes
information.description: Article 262 empowers Parliament to provide for the adjudication of disputes relating to waters of inter-state rivers or river valleys.

information.title: Freedom of Trade and Commerce
information.description: Article 301 ensures freedom of trade, commerce, and intercourse throughout the territory of India, subject to certain restrictions.
